pageDescription: Find answers to common questions about installation, licensing, and troubleshooting.

items.question: How do I purchase your products?
items.answer: The only way is right here on the official fedDSP website. Every product page has a BUY button that takes you straight to checkout.

items.question: What can I see in my account?
items.answer: Your account allows you to view all past orders, download receipts, retrieve license keys, and manage your email addresses.

items.question: Do I have to set up an account?
items.answer: A user account is automatically created for you by Lemon Squeezy after your first purchase. You simply need to sign in using the same email address that you used at checkout.

items.question: I logged into my account, but my licenses are missing.
items.answer: This usually happens if you used a different email address at checkout. Please check your purchase confirmation email to make sure that you are using the correct address. If you continue to run into problems, get in touch with support for help.

items.question: I changed my email address. What do I need to do?
I signed in with a different Apple or Google account than I used to purchase.
Why does my bank statement say 'LEMSQZY*' ?
items.answer: We use Lemon Squeezy as our secure payment processor. Charges may appear as LEMSQZY* on your statement.

items.question: Do you offer educational discounts?
items.answer: Not currently, although we are considering this for the future.

items.question: How do I install the plugins?
items.answer: Download the installer for your OS from our Downloads page, run it, and restart your DAW so it can scan the new plugins.

items.question: Where are the plugins installed?
items.answer: macOS: /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST3 and /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Components. Windows: C:\Program Files\Common Files\VST3. We only install to standard system locations.

items.question: How will I know about updates?
items.answer: The latest versions will always be available on the download page. We will notify product owners by email of a new version when it is released.

items.question: How do I completely uninstall plugins?
items.answer: Delete the plugin files from your system plugin folders: macOS: /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/VST3 and /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Components or Windows: C:\Program Files\Common Files\VST3. No additional files or services are installed.

items.question: Can I get a demo version?
items.answer: Yes. Demo versions are available from the Downloads page.

items.question: What are the limitations of the demo versions?
items.answer: The demos are fully functional but will output a brief silence periodically.

items.question: Can I get demo versions of Sample or IR packs?
items.answer: No. Due to the nature of unencrypted audio files, we cannot offer demos for sample or IR packs. Please use the audio examples on the product page to decide which pack is right for you.

items.question: How do I activate my license?
items.answer: Open the plugin, click the fedDSP logo, press 'Paste License', and paste the full key including BEGIN and END lines.

items.question: Can I activate without an internet connection?
items.answer: Yes. All licenses work entirely offline. Just paste your license key into the plugin.

items.question: How do I move my plugins to a new computer?
items.answer: Install the plugin on your new machine and activate using your existing license key. Please ensure that you remain within the limit of 3 personal activations per license.

items.question: Can I use my license on multiple computers?
items.answer: Yes. You can activate on up to 3 personal machines.

items.question: How do I deactivate a license?
items.answer: Open the plugin, click the fedDSP logo, and select 'Deactivate' to free an activation slot.

items.question: Can I sell or transfer my license?
items.answer: Yes. License transfers are handled manually. Email support@feddsp.com with your order details. A small charge is made for this service.

items.question: I found a bug. How do I report it?
items.answer: Email support@feddsp.com or report it in our Discord (join.feddsp.com/discord) with OS, DAW version, and reproduction steps.

items.question: The plugin is not showing up in my DAW.
items.answer: Restart your DAW, rescan plugins, and confirm your DAW is scanning standard system folders.

items.question: I'm experiencing CPU spikes or glitches.
items.answer: Ensure your buffer is at least 128 samples and that you are running the latest plugin version. Our plugins are extremely low CPU by design, so persistent issues usually indicate system or host configuration problems.

items.question: What is the Founders' Club?
items.answer: A limited group of early supporters who get exclusive pricing, early access, and direct influence on fedDSP development.

items.question: How do I join the Founders' Club?
items.answer: Purchase any product during the Founders' period. Eligibility is automatically applied.

items.question: What benefits does it offer?
items.answer: Permanent discounts, early access to new products, private betas, and priority support.

items.question: Is this lifetime membership?
items.answer: Yes. Once a Founder, always a Founder.

items.question: Is membership limited?
items.answer: Yes. Membership is capped and will close permanently once filled.

contact.text: Can't find what you're looking for? Get in touch with our support team:
